Summary During the 27 years I have spent at Intel Corp. I have gained a great deal of experience in many different fields: Dry Etch, Wet Etch, Lithography & Implant and also in clean room machines that incorporate Robotics, Vacuum, Pneumatic & Optics. My work demanded a wide spectrum of problem-solving skills, anywhere from early detection and repairment of errors to high availability, while using advanced tools such as MBPS. I have engaged in development and process improvement for high yield of components on silicon, together with finding cost effective solutions that will reduce the amount of chemical, gases and spare parts used and therefore saving millions of dollars. I pride myself in excellent teamwork, excelling in team-building and providing high level of service and support. 
Alongside my work at Intel Semiconductor, I was sent to its development center, orchestrating the transition from 200mm to 300mm silicon, and in 3 other occasions I was sent to bring forth the newest and most advanced technology to the Fab from the global development center. My responsibilities included the assembly of machines, inspections and amendment for its new process of creating the company's most innovative components.
